title.rendered: Top Three Sports Bets Coming Soon

content.rendered:
Top Three Sports Bets Coming Soon

Betting on sports is becoming more mainstream due to several states legalizing it after New Jersey pioneered its advocacy leading to the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act of 1992, also known as PASPA, being overturned a few years ago. Now every state in the union has the right to allow, or prohibit, sports betting in their jurisdiction.

But let’s not forget about the many offshore sportsbooks that have been a viable resource for bettors to make a wager for over 20 years. Just remember to do your homework and find an online sportsbook with a proven track record of paying out to customers in a timely manner and devoid of hassles and headaches.

Now that we’ve got that out of the way, let’s take a look at some major sporting events on the horizon where we can make a bet, and make some cash, while we enjoy the events.

Waste Management Phoenix Open

Dates: February 4th through the 7th, 2021

Course: TPC Scottsdale, Scottsdale, AZ

Course Lengths: 7,261 yards

Defending Champion: Webb Simpson

Tournament Record: -28 (Mark Calcavecchia 2001, Phil Mickelson 2013)

Par: 71

Some of the best golfers in the world will be in Scottsdale, Arizona to grip it and rip it at the TPC Scottsdale. There is a total of $7.3 million up for grabs and that’s enough to get anyone’s attention. There will be plenty of top-notch players to choose from at one of golf’s most widely attended tournaments.

“It’s been a long year for everyone, not just on the Waste Management Phoenix Open front. It’s been a long year for our country. I’m happy we’re about 25 days away.” said  tournament director Jenkins said. “It’s taken a lot of different shapes and planning but we think we have a really good plan in place and we’re going to execute on it.”

“The 2021 field is shaping up to be one of the best ever,” Jenkins said. “Nearly half of the Top-50 golfers in the world are coming to our event and represent Major championship winners, FedExCup winners, and some of the most recognizable and talented players in the world. That’s really special and something we’re very proud of.”

Five of the world’s top 10 golfers have committed to playing the Phoenix and if we have to pick a winner then our money is on the 2017 FedExCup champion, Justin Thomas!

Super Bowl LV

Date: February 7th, 2021

Where: Raymond James Stadium, Tampa, Florida

Teams: Kansas City Chiefs vs. Tampa Bay Bucs

The biggest game of the year in all of sports occurs on February 7th and Hollywood could not have imagined a more storybook matchup. Tom Brady, a living legend and still playing at an elite level at the age of 43, has taken a sub .500 club from last season, and a franchise that hasn’t sniffed the playoffs in 13 years, to the Super Bowl. It is his first season being in anything but a Patriots’ uniform, yet here he is…again…for the 10th time during his illustrious career.

On the other side of the field, we have the reigning Super Bowl champions, the Kansas City Chiefs. Patrick Mahomes is the heir-apparent to Tom Brady as a future Hall-of-Famer in the making. The 25-year-old Mahomes won the Super Bowl MVP Award last year when his Chiefs defeated the San Francisco 49ers, 31-20.

The oddsmakers are making the Chiefs a 3 to 3 ½ point favorite but we must consider that for the first time in Super Bowl history one of the participants is playing in its own stadium! That’s right, Raymond James Stadium, aka the Ray Jay, is Tampa’s home turf and that has to account for something. Grab the points even if you won’t need them and watch Tom Terrific win his seventh Super Bowl ring.

Daytona 500

Date: Sunday, February 14th, 2021 at 3:00 PM

Where: Daytona International Speedway

It would be easy to pick Denny Hamlin to win one of motor racing’s most prestigious events, as he has won the Daytona 500 the last two years and notched his first of three victories in 2016. But if we have to choose as to who will take the checkered flag, then our money is on the hard-driving Joey Logano.

The Team Penske star spoke about the Daytona 500 being the most prestigious NASCAR race on the schedule and how it is different from the others, “Everyone is out there racing extremely hard. Especially towards the end of the race, the pushing and shoving becomes very aggressive. That has been consistent over the years but as the rules package changes. Especially with this new spoiler on the back of it.”

And to hear the veteran driver talk about coming in first at Daytona as the only thing that matters, “You try to collect points while you can during the stages…At the end of the race, it’s like the championship. No one remembers who finished second. No one remembers who finished second in the Daytona 500 last year. That’s just what this race is about.”
